nodes.text: The Umbara alphabet was the written form of Umbarese, the language spoken by the species of the same name. It consisted of 26 letters, with a number of additional symbols for digits and punctuation marks. The basic shape of each letter or symbol was a circle or segment of circle, adorned with various dots, lines and other internal features.

The Umbara alphabet first appeared in "Darkness on Umbara," the seventh episode of the fourth season of the Star Wars: The Clone Wars television series, which aired on October 28, 2011. The alphabet was developed for The Clone Wars series by concept artist Chris Glenn, who based all letters within the alphabet on circles.
